summaries.short: Legasov and Shcherbina consider using lunar rovers to remove radioactive debris.
summaries.full: Legasov and Shcherbina consider using lunar rovers to remove radioactive debris, while Khomyuk faces government hurdles in determining the truth about the cause of the explosion.

summaries.short: Join host Peter Sagal and 'Chernobyl' creator, writer and executive producer Craig Mazin for this weekly podcast of the HBO miniseries.
summaries.full: In this official podcast of the HBO miniseries Chernobyl, host Peter Sagal (NPR’s “Wait Wait...Don't Tell Me!”) and series creator, writer and executive producer Craig Mazin discuss the true stories that shaped the scenes, themes and characters after each episode airs.

summaries.short: Legasov, Shcherbina and Khomyuk risk their lives and reputations to expose the truth about Chernobyl.
summaries.full: After being congratulated by the KGB for publicly affirming that the Chernobyl explosion was caused by "operator error," Legasov weighs the price of telling the truth at the upcoming criminal trial of Dyatlov, Bryukhanov and Fomin.

summaries.short: Lyudmilla ignores warnings about her firefighter husband's contamination.
summaries.full: April 30, 1986. After bribing her way into Hospital Number 6, Lyudmilla flouts a nurse's warnings about limiting her contact with Vasily. With the reactor fire contained, Legasov warns Shcherbina that a meltdown could contaminate drinking water for millions. Khomyuk vows to uncover the cause of the explosion; Legasov lays out a decontamination plan for surrounding areas.

summaries.short: THE CHERNOBYL PODCAST co-hosts Craig Mazin and Peter Sagal are joined by special guest Jared Harris for a bonus podcast.
summaries.full: THE CHERNOBYL PODCAST co-hosts Craig Mazin (creator, writer and executive producer of HBO’s Emmy(R)-nominated miniseries “Chernobyl”) and Peter Sagal (NPR’s “Wait Wait… Don’t Tell Me!”) are joined by special guest Jared Harris (Emmy(R)-nominated star of HBO’s “Chernobyl”) for a bonus podcast.

summaries.short: With millions at risk after the explosion, Ulana Khomyuk tries to warn Legasov about a second threat.
summaries.full: With untold millions at risk after the Chernobyl explosion, nuclear physicist Ulana Khomyuk makes a desperate attempt to reach Legasov and warn him about the threat of second explosion that could devastate the continent.

summaries.short: Plant workers and firefighters try to control a catastrophic 1986 explosion at a Soviet nuclear power plant.
summaries.full: April 26, 1986, USSR. An explosion at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant sends workers scrambling to assess the damage. When reports reach the control room that the reactor's core is "gone," deputy chief engineer Anatoly Dyatlov sends men to the core itself to investigate. Meanwhile, Vasily, a fireman, is summoned to help put out the fire, leaving behind his wife Lyudmilla.
